decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [080/CAR/0S,
004/MOR/001 - Rev.A, 
004/LON/002,
004/LON/004]

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Construction Times - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 5 - Refuse & Recycling (Implementation) - The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until the refuse and recycling storage facilities shown on the approved plans have been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Condition : 6 - Cycle Parking to be implemented - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the cycle parking shown on the plans hereby approved has been provided and made available for use. These facilities shall be retained for the occupants of and visitors to the development at all times.

Condition : 7 - Prior to the first use as a restaurant, a written scheme to manage the control of odour from cooking shall be submitted and approved in writing by the LPA. The approved scheme shall be fully installed, maintained and serviced in accordance with the manufacturers instructions or requirements, whilst the premises is open to serve food and shall reflect the type of food to be cooked. (If the end use includes cooking using coals or a wood fired appliance such as a wood fired pizza oven, then the extraction flue must be designed to accommodate this). The scheme submitted, including an odour risk assessment shall have regard to the technical requirements of the document `Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Extract Systems as produced by EMAQ dated 2018. Should the type of cooking change a further assessment shall be submitted in accordance with the above.

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies D4 and D14 of the London Plan 2021 and policies D12.1, D12.3 and P15.10 of the Local Plan 2024.

Condition : 8 - Prior to the first use as a restaurant, an assessment of the existing sound insulation at the premises shall be undertaken and submitted to the LPA with any proposed noise mitigation measures to be implemented to ensure any internal ventilation and extraction system and the general restaurant activity does not increase the noise levels or vibration in the upper floors of the property and neighbouring properties not associated with the development. Any required mitigation or additional insulation shall be implemented prior to the first use as a restaurant.



Reason: To ensure the development is Air Quality Neutral in line with draft�guidance (LPG) and does not worsen air quality and to comply with London Plan��policy SI1.

Condition : 9 - No refuse or waste material of any description shall be left or stored anywhere on the site other than within a building or refuse enclosure.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the property and the amenities of the area.

Condition : 10 - Noise levels, (expressed as the equivalent continuous sound level) LAeq (15 minutes), from any new plant/machinery from the commercial use shall not exceed LA90-5dB at the external boundary with any noise sensitive property not associated with the development. A post completion noise survey shall be submitted and approved by the LPA to demonstrate compliance with the noise criteria, thereafter the noise criteria shall be maintained.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjoining properties and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 and policy D12.3 of the Merton Local Plan 2024

Condition : 11 - Prior to the first use as a restaurant, an assessment of the existing sound insulation at the premises shall be undertaken, submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, with any proposed noise mitigation measures to be implemented, prior to the first use as a restaurant, to ensure any internal ventilation and extraction system and the general restaurant activity does not increase the noise levels or vibration in the upper floors of the property and neighbouring properties not associated with the development.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjoining properties and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 and policy D12.3 of the Merton Local Plan 2024

Condition : 12 - 
Prior to the first use as a restaurant, a written scheme to manage the control of odour from cooking shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved scheme shall be fully installed, maintained and serviced in accordance with the manufacturers instructions or requirements, whilst the premises is open to serve food. The scheme submitted, including an odour risk assessment shall have regard to the technical requirements of the document 'Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Extract Systems' as produced by EMAQ dated 2018. Should the type of cooking change a further assessment shall be submitted in accordance with the above.

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies D4 and D14 of the London Plan 2021 and policies D12.1, D12.3 and P15.10 of the Local Plan 2024.

Condition : 13 - Hours of Use - The restaurant Class E Use hereby permitted shall operate only between the following hours:

Monday 08.00-23.59
Tuesday 08.00-23.59
Wednesday 08.00-23.59
Thursday 08.00-23.59
Friday 08.00-23.59
Saturday 08.00-01.00
Sunday 08.00-23.59

Bank Holidays 08.00-23.59

Condition : 14 - Prior to the first use as a restaurant, drainage serving the kitchen in commercial part of the premises shall be fitted with an adequate grease separator.

Reason: To protect the amenities of the occupiers in the local vicinity

Condition : 15 - Prior to the fist use as a restaurant, the development hereby approved shall implement the fire safety measures as submitted with the proposal titled: Fire Statement. These measures shall thereafter be retained in perpetuity 

Reason: To ensure that the development complies with policy D12 of the London Plan 2021

Condition : 16 - The amount of takeout sales shall remain at 10% or below in order to maintain the Class E(b) use and shall not exceed this percentage.
 
Reason: To ensure that the development complies with policy E9 of the London Plan 2021 and to protect Class E use of the site

Condition : 17 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].

ii) The application was amended following negotiations with the Council to ensure the scheme complied with adopted policy and guidance, and a decision was made [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].
Condition : 18 - The opening hours stipulated on the application form shall not be increased.

Condition : 19 - INFORMATIVE
Building Regulations 
Please note that this is a planning permission only and you may also require approval under the Building Regulations. If you are in any doubt about this you can get further information via https://www.merton.gov.uk/planning-and-buildings/building-control  or by emailing building.control@merton.gov.uk.

Condition : 20 - INFORMATIVE
You are advised to contact the Council's Highways team on 020 8545 3700 before undertaking any works within the Public Highway to obtain the necessary approvals and/or licences. Please be advised that there is a further charge for this work. If your application falls within a Controlled Parking Zone this has further costs involved and can delay the application by 6 to 12 months.

Condition : 21 - INFORMATIVE
Any works/events carried out either by, or at the behest of, the developer, whether they are located on, or affecting a prospectively maintainable highway, as defined under Section 87 of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991, or on or affecting the public highway, shall be co-ordinated under the requirements of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991 and the Traffic management Act 2004 and licensed accordingly in order to secure the expeditious movement of traffic by minimising disruption to users of the highway network in Merton. Any such works or events commissioned by the developer and particularly those involving the connection of any utility to the site, shall be co-ordinated by them in liaison with the London Borough of Merton, Network Coordinator, (telephone 020 8545 3976). This must take place at least one month in advance of the works and particularly to ensure that statutory undertaker connections/supplies to the site are co-ordinated to take place wherever possible at the same time.
